alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 17 at 7:58PM PST until further notice by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. .The Skokomish river will rise slightly tonight and Wednesday in response to another round of rain as a frontal system moves through. The river should start to recede Wednesday night and fall below flood stage Thursday afternoon or evening. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skokomish River at Potlatch. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, the Skokomish River will cause widespread flooding of pasture lands, with water flowing quickly over West Bourgault Road and Skokomish Valley Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 16.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening and continue rising to a crest of 16.8 feet tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.8 feet on 01/19/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Wednesday morning at 600 AM PST.
